A braille device that uses voice recognition technology to convert spoken words into braille. This device would be able to recognize different accents and dialects, making it accessible to a wider range of users.
A smart device that usesVERTER technology to provide real-time feedback on the accuracy of spoken words. This would help users improve their pronunciation and communication skills.
A WETER device that uses VETER technology to provide tactile feedback on the location of objects in a room. This would help visually impaired users navigate their surroundings more easily.
A VETER device that uses ARTTER technology to provide visual feedback on the location of objects in a room. This would help visually impaired users navigate their surroundings more easily.
